notes: Seven are killed when a bomb detonates on a Potiskum bus. Perpetrators not known.

assoc_actor_1: MOSOP: Movement for the Survival of the Ogoni People
notes: Hundreds of youths from the eight local government areas that make up Rivers West senatorial district protested at the PDP headquarters in Port Harcourt in what they described as the sham primary election of the party for the senatorial district. The group, under the aegis of MOSOP, threatened to boycott an upcoming election. MOSOP held a similar protest in Port Harcourt earlier in the week.

Four are dead following two non-consecutive days of clashes in Mangu LGA (specific locations not known) between Fulanis and a group of unnamed Mwagahvuu speaking people. The clashes occurred on or between December 31 2014 and January 2, 2015. Note: Mangu and Barakin Ladi are adjacent; each event may have been spill over from a connecting area.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen have kidnapped 40 boys and young men in Malari on New Year's Eve. The kidnapping is believed to be forces conscription into their fighting force.
Soldiers shot and killed a suspected suicide bomber outside a military barracks in Bolari after she refused to be searched. The affiliation of the bomber unknown.
A suicide bomb exploded in Maiduwa town, killing six people; the perpetrator was in the car at the time of the attack.

"Indigenes" (possibly Bassa) attack a Fulani settlement at Ekpan-Abugi location, Kupa district of Lokoja Local Government. Several buildings damages, causalities not known. Exact date of the attack not know. Source claims the attack occurred "recently."

Unidentified gunmen beheaded one person and shot dead another in Kantoma village of Mangu Local Government Area, Plateau state. Residents blame Fulani herdsmen, though authorities have not speculated as to the perpetrator.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A group of three suicide bombers detonate their vehicle at a security checkpoint killing only themselves. Military injuries not known.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram attack Kautakari, kills fifteen residents. Witnesses said scores of insurgents armed with rifles and petrol bombs stormed Kautakari around 7am. Kautakari is in the Chibok area.
Hundreds of people took to the streets in Saminaka town, headquarters of Lere Local Government Area of Kaduna State over the posting of a Sharia court judge to the area.

Youths and other supporters of an All Progressives Congress (APC) senatorial aspirant from Delta State protested at the partys national secretariat in Abuja over alleged imposition of another candidate as the partys flag bearer for Delta South senatorial district. The Delta Coalition for Change (DCC) were also involved in the protest.

assoc_actor_1: MOSOP: Movement for the Survival of the Ogoni People
notes: Hundreds of protesters from Ogoniland under the aegis of MOSOP shut business activities and vehicular traffic along the Port Harcourt-Aba Road in Port Harcourt to protest against their perceived political and environmental marginalisation by political parties in Rivers State.
A bomb blast targeting spectators of a football game detonated and kills a sugarcane vendor in in Potiskum. No other reported deaths or injuries.

Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen were reported to have invaded Tattaura village in Sanga Local Government Area of Kaduna State, killing 10 people about 10p.m. on Saturday, 27/12.

Two German engineers are killed while travelling in Nigeria. Location not known, though the company they worked for, Julius Berger, headquartered in Abuja. It was reported the pair was on a motorcycle trip; likely not far from their HQ. Perpetrators not known.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed 10 civilians in Tataura. A few other victims sustained varying degrees of injury. The source describes the gunmen as "bandits, "though did not articulate anything stolen from the victims.
Police shoot and kill two Fulani brothers who refused to bay a bribe. The police were later arrested.
Police disrupt a Bring Back our Girls protest with a barricade in Abuja. The barricade "enraged" the protesters, though there was no report of violent incident.

Oron youths in Akwa Ibom protested over "undue marginalisation" of Oron nation by the current administration. The youths, numbering more than 1,000, conducted a peaceful demonstration march from Oron to Civic Centre, Oron Beach and Oya Oron Junction.
A suspected suicide bomber of unknown origin rammed an automobile into a military checkpoint in Bajoga. No heavy damage reported.

Two protesters (some accounts report 10) were injured by police gunfire when they intervened at the government house.

Thousands of Ogoni youths protest the APC partys decision to nominate a particular candidate for governor. They said [the party] deceived the Ogonis into thinking that he would give the governorship ticket to them. [The protesters] blocked major junctions of the East-West Road at Eleme, Akpajo and Tai in the early hours of the day before heading to the main gate of Government House, Port Harcourt, where they lit tyres and other incendiary materials and sang war songs. Two protesters (some accounts report 10) were injured by police gunfire when they intervened at the government house.

notes: At least 30 Boko Haram fighters were killed by operatives of the Civilian-JTF (BVYG) when the insurgents attempted to attack Kareto and Gubio villages in Mobbar Local Government Area of Borno State.

notes: Soldiers and vigilante members took complete control of Mubi, Adamawa State as Boko Haram militants fled the town after suffering a heavy defeat. The preceding battle lasted over two days, but soldiers did not enter the heart of the city, gaining control, until 26/11. "Many" Boko Haram deaths reported.

Over 200 traders staged a peaceful protest in Awka over alleged imposition of levies and invasion of their market at Igbo-Ukwu in Aguata local government area by alleged hoodlums. The protesters, who stormed the Anambra Government House, Awka, at about 2pm carried placards some of which read "we want peace at Igbo-Ukwu main market."

assoc_actor_1: ASUU: Academic Staff Union of Universities
notes: Academic Staff Union of Universities, ASUU, Delta State University, Abraka, stormed Asaba in protest against the kidnap of one of its members and called on their abductors to release them unconditionally. The protesters also went to the Nigeria Television Authority, NTA, Asaba station, and the state police headquarters. The details of the kidnapping itself are not known.

Military forces battle with a group of kidnappers on an Ijaw leader who was abducted on 16/11. The leader was freed as a result of the shootout. Causality figure not known. The identities and motives of the kidnappers remain unknown.

"Hoodlums" stormed Iyana-Idikan, Agbaje, and Ayeye communities of Ibadan, areas looting, breaking, burning and carting away goods and products of traders in the market. According to traders in the market, the rampage started around 10pm on Monday till about 5am on Tuesday and it was alleged that frantic calls were made to the police, but to no avail. No reported injuries.
Suspected cattle rustlers attack Lilo, killing fifty. The attackers were also alleged to have burnt some houses and destroyed other property worth millions of naira.

A pair of teenaged female suicide bombers detonated at a market in Maiduguri during the mid-morning hours, at least 45 deaths plus injuries. The source does not articulate any suspicions as to the perpetrator, but many suspect Boko Haram.

Students of the University of Jos besieged the Bauchi road campus of the institution protesting alleged increment in school fees. They also called on the Vice Chancellor to rescind his decision or resign.

The secretariat of the Cross River State chapter of PDP was rocked by explosion suspected to be a bomb blast. The incident happened as the party was gearing up to distribute materials to hold its ward congress. No life was lost, though the building was damaged. Injuries not known. Perpetrators not known.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Soldiers and vigilante members eventually took complete control of Mubi, Adamawa State as Boko Haram militants fled the town after suffering a heavy defeat. No fewer than 10 PDP supporters were injured over a inter-party leadership struggle. The clash began at the party secretariat.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram seizes Damasak after a early morning battle with military forces. Details on casualty were not clear at press time, but sources said the militants went to the centre of the market brandishing their assault rifles. Many of the residents fled into nearby Cameroon.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks two areas near Chibok, killing 20 and destroying property.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram reportedly killed 48 people in an attack on fish sellers at Abadam near Baga in northern Borno State near the border with Chad. Witnesses said those killed were traders ambushed while on their way to buy fish. Some had their throats slit while

notes: Boko Haram attacks two areas near Chibok, killing 20 and destroying property.

A group of Ora Ara indigenes protest against the Minister of State, warning her not to appoint a non-indigene to a local position of power.

A senior district head in the Bauchi Emirate Council was shot by unidentified gunmen in Bauchi. He was on his way home after the Ishai prayer at a nearby mosque. The wounds were not deemed to be life threatening.

Two persons were feared killed in a clash between supporters of the Chairman of the Community Development Association (CDA) and chairman of youth association in Aruogba community in Oredo Local Council of Edo State over a tussle for the chairmanship position of the communitys association. Some houses were also reportedly razed.

Gunmen, suspected to be Fulani mercenaries launched an offensive attack at Digan Dogo in Kadarko community of Keana Local Government Area of Nasarawa State, leaving scores dead and injuring many people. Specific numbers not provided.

Nigerian security forces fired teargas on opposition (APC) lawmakers inside the parliament complex as they attempted to enter for a key vote on emergency rule in the northeast. Members of Tambuwals All Progressives Congress (APC) party have described the state of emergency first imposed in May last year as a failure because of escalating violence and have argued it should not be renewed. No injuries reported. A similar attempt against APC lawmakers occurred two days prior.

notes: Military leaders report they have forcibly regained three areas lost to Boko Haram the previous week: Gombi, Pelia and Hong, killing "many" members of Boko Haram. Specific date(s) not known.

Enrolees of the public work scheme in Kwara State staged a protest over non-payment of their three-month stipends in Ilorin.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks the village of Azaya Kura in Mafa LGA, killing 45 residents. Additionally, the attackers destroyed houses, stole food and livestock.

Students of state-run institutions protest along the Benin-Ore expressway at Dawson Road in Benin City over a prolonged government strike. The students, who carried placards with various inscriptions, barricaded the two dual carriage roads with used tyres, benches and plastic chairs, leaving motorists stranded for hours. They also attempted to storm the state Ministry of Education in Iyaro before they were dispersed by security operatives. No reported injury.

Angered at what they considered as the bleak lot of the kidnapped Chibok girls, impunity and discriminatory law enforcement, leaders of the All Progressives Congress (APC) marched on Louis Edet House, headquarters of the Nigeria Police Force in Abuja. No report of police response.

Non-violent activity: Police fired tear gas at opposition members (APC mainly) of the Nigerian House of Representatives as they tried to enter their legislative chamber, attempting to stop them from convening. Despite the gas, the lawmakers entered the building, calling for the impeachment of President Johathan. No reported injuries.
"Overzealous" soldiers killed eight civilians in the Shinge area in Lafia, apparently mistaking them for members of the Ombatse militia.
A mob attacks and sets alight a man they suspected to be a suicide bomber.
Kanberi and Eggon youths clash in Lafia for a second day - twelve deaths reported among to two sects, 30 houses destroyed in the Farin Kasa area of the city - many other residents were displaced.
Two union groups (MTUN/OWAN) attack a police station after it was alleged one of their members was shot by an officer. No reported injuries.

Eggon youths engage a group of soldiers who were attempting to disperse a clash between they and Kanberi youths. Seven Eggon deaths reported. At another place in the city the soldiers shot and killed four Eggon youths who were blocking a road.
Okrika people staged a protest over alleged refusal of the Federal Government to recognise them as a host community to the seaport.

A clash between people from Okrika, in Okrika Local Council and Onne, in Eleme Local Council of Rivers State has left at least two persons dead and several others injured. The clash began after people from Onne and Ogu communities attacked a group of protesters from Okrika, which led to an intense fight.

Unidentified gunmen attacked a popular hotel in Abonnema, Akuku Torlu LGA of Rivers State, killing two persons and injuring three. A witness described the incident as "barbaric and inhumane." It could not be ascertained what led to the shooting, even as no group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
Kanberi and Eggon youths clash over communal disagreements in Lafia. Causalities not known.

Suspected Fulani gunmen attack Alakyo (unknown location) and nearby Shabu, Nasarawa State during the early hours of 16/11. Persons displaced by the fresh violence gave two different account of the situation: The first version says gunmen suspected to be Fulanis stormed Alakyo in their numbers, killing many, and razed properties worth millions of naira. The second version said the Fulani gunmen attempted to enter Alakyo, but were repelled by gunmen, suspected to be Eggon. Specific causality number not known.
Members of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Ilorin staged a protest over an alleged attempt to manipulate the delegates list for the forthcoming governorship primaries.
Military forces shot and killed one, injured three others, when they opened fire on a group of protesters who were protesting against military infighting.
Twenty are believed dead while 56 were injured as a suicide bomb blast hit an Azare market during the evening hours. The source does not speculate on the responsible party.

An Ijaw leader is kidnapped in Ethiope East LGA while returning from Kokori following a conference. Many in the Ijaw community blame Kokori residents for his disappearance, and threaten to "invade" the town. Despite the circumstantial evidence the perpetrators are not officially known.
A journalist is abducted in Abia State, location unknown. The man was later released.

assoc_actor_1: QOAN: Quarry Owners Association of Nigeria
notes: Members of the Quarry Owners Association of Nigeria (QOAN) in Ondo State "at the weekend" protested what they described as "unlawful collection of multiple taxes by the government". The group confronted government tax collectors along the Ifon-Benin Expressway near Elegbeka. No violent incident was reported.
There was commotion during the afternoon hours in Ibadan, Oyo State, as a large number of youths protested the alleged killing of an unidentified young man in the custody of the police.

Itsekiri youths protest the groundbreaking of a Export Processing Zone (EPZ), giving seven-day ultimatum to President Goodluck Jonathan to reschedule the date of ceremony to comport with local ethnic sensibilities vis a vis those of neighbouring Ijaw.

Over one thousand women from Okirigwe and Amukpe communities in Sapele Local Government Area of Delta State weekend stormed Amupke Flow station of SEPLAT Petroleum Development Company in protest against alleged non-compliance of the company with a non-compliance of a law. The protest occurred "at the weekend" - exact date not known.

Unidentified persons attack a voter registration centre in the Oke-Efon area of Abeokuta. The area was filled with tension, as about ten persons were seriously injured by the group who attacked the venue with guns and other weapons.

A group of women from Irete community protest insecurity in their area after an increased report of sexual assaults. The group protested along the Owerri/Onitsha express way, causing traffic problems. Police in the area dispersed the protesters.

Hundreds of youths protested in the state capital for the removal of Imam of the Jimeta after the Imam criticised the governments attitude toward ongoing Boko Haram insecurity in the area. The Imams palace was burned down by the protesters.
Protesters "overran" the local Headquarters of the Independent National Electoral Commission over alleged voter disenfranchisement. Traffic was also reported disrupted.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Boko Haram detonates a suicide blast at a Kano JTF base, killing the bomber and 5 security operatives.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram members attack Hong, razing a police station and raising their flag about the home of a military general. Causalities not known.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram shoots two and burns a police station in Gombi. The attackers were initially repelled by security forces, but came back soon after to overtake the city. The attackers are believed to be part of the band which was recently ousted from Maiha.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap the son of a former PDP chairman.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad

notes: Nigerian forces recapture Mubi, causing much of the Boko Haram population to flee. Several Boko Haram deaths claimed by residents, though specific number were not provided.
The University of Lagos (UNILAG) was temporarily disrupted on Wednesday morning as lecturers staged a protest around the campus over what they described as harsh working conditions.

A group of PDP youths numbering over 400 picketed the state secretariat of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Cross River protesting the withholding of the delegates list that was the outcome of the partys ward congresses.

Hundreds of aggrieved traders in Awka protested at the state police command headquarters, protesting alleged extortion and intimidation of their members and customers by policemen from the command. No reported incidents.

assoc_actor_1: PASAN: Parliamentary Staff Association of Nigeria
notes: National Assembly workers under the aegis of Parliamentary Staff Association of Nigeria (PASAN) staged a peaceful protest over unpaid salaries and accumulated allowances due to them at the lobby of NASS.

notes: No fewer than 75 Boko Haram militants were killed and Maiha recaptured by local hunters. Of the dead, 10 may have been civilians Boko Haram executed while fleeing. Maiha had been overrun and captured by Boko Haram just days earlier.
Members of the PDP and Labour Party attack each other during a local government rerun election after ballot boxes were alleged to have been stolen. Four reported dead, plus other injuries.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A female Boko Haram suicide bomber killing at least three people at a teachers college in Kontagora, northwest Nigeria.
Residents of Ifaki protest a prolonged power outage in their area.
A school administrator is attacked and killed by a group of students after disiplinary measures were seen as unjust.

Aggrieved members of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Egor Local Government Council protested the alleged screening of an aspirant of the party for the House of Assembly seat in Egor, who was last week remanded at Oko prison for alleged attempted murder.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram invades Maiha town in the late afternoon, firing on military forces as they fled with the residents. Soon after the takeover Boko Haram raised their flag above the city. No causalities reported.

A group of human rights activists and civil society practitioners known as "The Nucleus Group" flooded Lagos State Governors Office and Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) in the state to protest failed distribution of permanent voters cards.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A suspected member of Boko Haram, dressed in a school uniform, detonates a suicide ordinance at a all boys school in Potiskum, killing 47. The figure was raised to 58 in passing days, with 117 injured (AFP).
Residents of Danare, a border town with Cameroon, protest a proposed UN boundary demarcation which would cede parts of the area to Cameroon.
Unidentified gunmen have kidnapped the younger brother to the former Chairman of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) and governorship aspirant in Adamawa State.
Kwara State APC members protest at the home of the party leader, alleging alleged marginalisation in the distribution of elective positions.

Suspected Fulani gunmen ambushed and killed 25 persons (one report hold death total at more than 39) returning from a peace summit convened by the traditional ruler of Arikya chiefdom. The gunmen, numbering over 50 were said to have struck around 3pm at Soni Arikya where they barricaded the Nasarawa Eggon/Arikya road, killing most of the people who attended the peace summit as they made their way back to Nasarawa Eggon.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill the head driver of the state governor at Tudun Adabu village in Obi LGA.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A bomb concealed in a plastic bag detonated in a bank line causing fourteen death and scores injured. Boko Haram is believed to be responsible.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram invades Gashaka, demanding to know the whereabouts of three retired generals who hold residence in the town. After not receiving the information they demanded the attackers set fire to a church and shot a civilian.

Former councillors and political appointees in Cross River State local government system took to the streets of Calabar, the state capital in protest over what they said was the non-payment of their severance allowances.
Members of the PDP protest in Abuja seeking the disqualification of a party candidate whom they believe would bring disrepute to the party.
Cross River chiefs and other members of the Boki local government protest UN visit to demarcate land. Date and specific location not known. Source dated 10/11.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram clashed with military forces in Malam Fatori (Bisagana), causing 21 civilian bystander deaths. It was later reported Boko Haram had taken over the village.
Unidentified attackers, suspected to be from a neighbouring village, attack Afam Uku, kidnap two and destroy buildings. The attack is believed to have been motivated in reprisal for an unknown issue.
Hawkers protest after a colleague is killed in a street accident.
Street sweepers protest over the non-payment of salaries.
Staff of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs staged a protest over unpaid salaries and allowances in the premises of the ministry in Abuja.
Youths stormed the National Assembly and demanded that lawmakers reconvene plenary in the next 10 days or face further, possibly violent, demonstrations.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attacks the headquarters of a French-owned cement company, steals money, trucks and dynamite. The attackers killed five soldiers at a checkpoint, as well as four civilians.

notes: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen carrying grenade launchers attacked the security services in Nafada. The attack in Gombe state came just after midday and began with a gunfight at a military checkpoint on the outskirts of Nafada town, causalities not known.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Air Forces bomb Fika town, known Boko Haram stronghold. Causalities, damage unknown.
The casual workers at Midland Rolling Mills, an Indian-owned company based in Abeokuta, protested poor work conditions.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A convoy of suspected Boko Haram gunmen carrying grenade launchers attacked a bank, a cement factory and a political party office in Nafada. The gunmen moved into the town, where eleven were killed.
A university student is hacked to death with an axe by an unknown assailant. The reason for the attack is not known.
Residents of Tambuwal and Kebbe local government areas protested the withdrawal of the security aides of the Speaker of House of Representatives.
A group of widows protest the impeachment of a female local council boss.

Victims of various bomb attacks around the Federal Capital Territory, Abuja, protested alleged negligence by the Federal Government. They also claim abandonment in various hospitals, as well as failure to offset the bills that had accrued in the course of their treatments.

assoc_actor_1: NEPWHAN: Network of People Living with HIV/AIDS in Nigeria
notes: NEPWHAN barricade the doors of National Agency for Control of AIDS in Abuja over inadequate government funding for their treatments. The group vowed to protest for an extended period.
The Federal Polytechnic , Ado Ekiti, was shut down following a protest staged by students against a hike in tuition fees payable in the institution.

Hawkers shut down the ever-busy Aba/Port Harcourt Expressway in protest of the death of their colleague who was killed by a motorist. The situation caused severe gridlock in the capital city, as other motorists scampered for safety following a hot chase with stones by the hawkers. No reported injury.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated explosives in the midst of a Shiite religious procession in Potiskum, Yobe, killing himself and 15 others. Some reports claim 32 dead.

Boko Haram (actor not confirmed) attacks a prison in Koton Karifi, overpowers security forces and frees 145 inmates. Two deaths reported, both security forces. Several fugitives were recovered by police in the following days.
Fulani raiders kill a man, kidnap two women and three boys in Umuachi-Afor.

Boat drivers under the Maritime Workers Union protest in several areas along the coast of Bayelsa State, including Brass town, and along the waterways and coastline of Nembe, Southern Ijaw and Ekeremor local government councils. The group was protesting against increased pirate activity in the region.

More than 30 people died and many got injured on Friday morning when a bomb went off at a popular motor park in Gombe. Perpetrators not known, though three were captured by police as they attempted to flee.

Boat drivers under the Maritime Workers Union protest in several areas along the coast of Bayelsa State, including Brass town, and along the waterways and coastline of Nembe, Southern Ijaw and Ekeremor local government councils. The group was protesting against increased pirate activity in the region.

Boat drivers under the Maritime Workers Union protest in several areas along the coast of Bayelsa State, including Brass town, and along the waterways and coastline of Nembe, Southern Ijaw and Ekeremor local government councils. The group was protesting against increased pirate activity in the region.

notes: Military forces and the "Civilian JTF" kill 41 members of Boko Haram in a gun battle in Gur. One members of Boko Haram was captured alive. Following the battle soldiers severed the heads of the deceased Boko Haram combatants.

Boat drivers under the Maritime Workers Union protest in several areas along the coast of Bayelsa State, including Brass town, and along the waterways and coastline of Nembe, Southern Ijaw and Ekeremor local government councils. The group was protesting against increased pirate activity in the region.
Unidentified arsonists set the PDP party secretariat alight in Port Harcourt. No injuries reported.

assoc_actor_1: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
assoc_actor_2: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
notes: Two groups of the NURTW clash in the Ekefa area of Ibadan over fees. No casualties, several injuries. The clash sparked a protest from another group who wanted to be removed from the union.
Following a clash between two groups of NURTW in Ibadan, a group protests, asking demanding to be removed from the union.
Students of National Open University demonstrated at one of their study centres over poor internet connectivity.
One person is dead and two are in a coma after two factions of the PDP clashed during a disagreement as who were to make list of the delegates.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram overruns and captures Vimtim, near Bazza. Causalities not known. Vimtim is the home town of the Chief of Defence Staff, but it is not clear if Boko Harams effort coincidental.

Boko Haram fighters launched a major attack in Adamawa State, capturing the commercial town of Mubi, where they killed many people (later reported as 200 dead over two days) and released inmates from a prison. Many military forces had fled the area prior to the attack, leaving only a few, who were quickly overrun. Causality specifics not known. Boko Haram militants have also hoisted the sects flag and imposed a curfew in Mubi.
Rioting youths besiege a police station to protest the killing of a protester last week in Ndikpa. The protesters demanded compensation for their loss. No reported violence.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: In a coordinated effort to overtake Mubi, Boko Haram also captures Mararaba Hildi and the entirety of Borno States Uba LGA. No reported violence in the latter two.
Edo State workers under the Coalition of Unions of Edo State Owned Tertiary Institutions took to the streets to protest non- payment of their five months salaries and poor condition of service.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Artillery fire reported in Gaya during a Boko Haram sacking of nearby Mubi, which Boko Haram overtook. Causalities/injuries not known.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: In a coordinated effort to overtake Mubi, Boko Haram also captures Mararaba Hildi and the entirety of Borno States Uba LGA. Boko Haram reportedly kill 5 civilians in Uba.

At least two people were killed in what indigenes say is a land dispute clash between Iregwe and Rukuba speaking nationals of Bassa Local Government Area of northern Plateau state, exact location not known.
Protesters in Calabar protest a roads dilapidated state.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram launches a large attack over two days on Mubi, eventually killing 200+ and taking over the village on the second day.
"Thugs" stormed an APC venue and began assaulting observers and delegates, causing many to flee.

assoc_actor_1: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
notes: Members of the NURTW protest after a commercial bus driver dies after being assaulted by a mob of LASTMA official while on the job - apparently, their request for an extortion payment had been refused. Several automobile were destroyed during the protest. Police forces dispersed the crowd. No injuries reported.

Staffers of Adeniran Ogunsanya College of Education (AOCOED) stormed Lagos State Secretariat and the office of the state Governor to protest against alleged "anomalies" in the institution, which included the non-payment of pensions.
A group of patients who were denied candidacy for treatment at the specialist hospital protest.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram invaded Kukawa town setting ablaze the Kukawa police station, government lodge and other public buildings in the town and over 250 vehicles. A resident of the town said the insurgents stormed the town in several Hilux vehicles and motorcycles and moved straight to the police station and started shooting sporadically targeting residents, using Rocket Propelled Launchers and AK47 rifles. Causalities reported ("many"), numbers not known.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015) Lagos State Traffic Management Authority
assoc_actor_2: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
notes: A mob of LASTMA beat up and pushed NURTW a conductor to death after he refused an extortion payment. In turn NURTW members riot in anger.
Medical students at Kaduna State University protest the non-accreditation of their faculty.
PDP factions clash at the partys secretariat in Jos over the nomination of candidates. No injuries reported.

PDP Eggon youths violently protest their partys nomination for a governorship seat outside the palace of the local Eggon ruler. Many of the youths lit fires and forcibly pushed themselves through the gate of the palace. Anti-riot soldiers dispersed the crowd. The governorship contenders were unhurt, though one was kidnapped by unidentified armed men several hours later.
A PDP candidate for Nasarawa governor is abducted from his home several hours after he and two others were attacked by fellow PDP members who were displeased with his candidacy.

A suspected burglar was in the early hours of killed by a mob after he was allegedly caught carting away bottles of wine and alcoholic beverages from the shop he and his accomplices burgled. The victim was still alive when he was taken to hospital.
Hundreds of supporters of Ekiti State Governor (PDP) trooped to the streets to protest alleged plan by members of the state House of Assembly to impeach the governor.
Ten are injured and twenty cars destroyed after prominent chief allegedly sent "thugs" to disrupt an election ballot inspection.
Protest broke out in some centres especially in Delta South and Central Senatorial Districts over alleged disappearance of result sheets from the election materials. Exact locations not known.
A lecturer at the Taraba College of Education (COE) Zing, was burnt to death in a mob action after he allegedly hit and killed five primary school pupils with a vehicle he was driving.

Military forces shoot six, kill two when residents not complying with an environmental order refuse arrest.

Villagers protested an attempt by a land speculator to take their communal land. One is reportedly dead after a police officer fired a weapon in error. Date not known. Source dated 30/10 cites "last week."

Personnel of the Ministry of Information stage a protest at the entrance to the Radio House over alleged maladministration and embezzlement during the tenure of the Secretary.

Members of the APM protest the second term bid of the lawmaker representing Aba North and South in the House of Representatives, believing the lawmaker had served long enough and did not property represent their constituency properly.

notes: Boko Haram gunmen attack a Lake Chad community in Abadam LGA, killing 10.

Supports of the APC protest the arrest of several fellow APC lawmakers of the Edo State house after it was alleged they had forged signatures of their PDP colleagues. The protesters called the arrests part of a PDP "witch hunt".
Ten are injured in a clash between two PDP factions in Lafia. The clash stemmed from a disagreement of who should represent the party in an upcoming election.

The Nigerian Human Rights Community (NHRC) staged a protest against what it called the rising wave of unemployment and hunger in the country. The protest began at the Ikeja Under-bridge at about 10am, and ended at the Lagos State Government House.
Nursing students protest the state of non-accreditation of their school.

An unnamed private security officer attached to the Jos University Teaching Hospital (JUTH) was shot dead by unknown gunmen. The gunmen stormed the hospital at about 12:30a.m and were about forcing their way into the premises but were stopped by the security men for routine stop and search exercise before being allowed in.

Thousands of Christians, members of various church denominations protest in Ilorin early hours of the morning to protest the taking over of their schools by Kwara state government, demanding that they want their schools back in their control. The school takeover is related to the areas Ebola outbreak.

A group known as the Delta State League of Online Registration Agents, protested their members withdrawal as online registration agents by the Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board (JAMB), believe the removal "arbitrary." The group protests at the JAMB officer and later at the Delta State house assembly building.
Members of CAN protest against the planned disinvestment of a cement manufacturing facility by the Benue State government, believing the state economy would be harmed.
Bring Back Our Girls supports hold a protest in Abuja to mark the 6-month anniversary of the Chibok abduction.

assoc_actor_1: APGA: All Progressives Grand Alliance Party
notes: Over 5,000 members of the All Progressives Grand Alliance (APGA) from 21 Local Government Areas in Anambra State gathered Nnewi, to protest the defection of former State Governor to another political party.

Unidentified armed youth attack a truck carrying "cattle and humans" near the government house in Lafia. Government forces respond, beginning the 30 minute gun battle. Two killed, five injured, many others fled.

An armed clash between Fulani gunmen and a local vigilante group at Kankara market caused five deaths and scores of injuries. Following the battle, the vigilantes launched a patrol to find any remaining Fulanis in the area.

Ahead of the opening of Delta State's Revenue House in Warri on 14/10, hundreds of indigenes of Okere Urhobo Kingdom, stormed the premises , protesting alleged refusal of the chairman to grant them audience on employment and other community relations matters.

Scores of lecturers from the Adeniran Ogunsanya College of Education (AOCOED), Ijanikin, staged a protest to the State House, Alausa, over what they termed as failure of the Lagos State Government to remit over 17 months deducted funds to their pension accounts and non-payment of retirees benefits for three years.

Unknown gunmen in Anguwan Mallam area of Obi Local Government in Nasarawa State reportedly killed three persons after ambushing a passenger bus travelling from Alushi. A police officer was also wounded in the attack and is now missing. It is not clear if the officer a target of the attackers, or a bystander. Some locals suspect the perpetrators to be Eggon youths, but this is still left to be determined.
A group of ex-Ogun State political appointees protest the non-payment of pensions.

Fulani gunmen attack the Berom villages of Lwa, Dum, Rachit, Dyang, Sharbutu, Rachi, Diyan, Rakweng, Chengye, Fang, Rim and Shonong in Riyom over ten consecutive days (2/10 - 11/10). Several killed (varying reports), 80 houses razed over the course of the ten days. It is not clear which villages were attacked on which date(s), with the exception of Rim and Shonong which are known to have been attacked on 09/10 - - Shonong is attacked again on 11/10 causing six deaths.
Soldiers Saturday night stormed Durumi settlement area in Abuja where they shot three Gwaza refugees while arresting others. The reason for the raid is not clear.
A prison riot kills "scores" and injured 12 when police respond. The riot, which began as a protest over the confiscation of an inmates cooling fan.

Fulani gunmen ambush a group of soldiers on a patrol between Fadan Karshi (Fadan Kaibi) to Karshi Daji. One soldier killed, four injured. The gunmen split into three groups, one continuing into Fadan Kaibi, where they killed 12 villiagers, burnt down 20 houses and injured scores. Another group (or the same, later) went to Karshi Daji, killed 20 people and burnt down several houses. The third group attacked Unguwan Ganye, though casualties are not known.

It was gathered that when the militants discovered that Konduga was a no go area, they headed to nearby Benisheikh and laid ambush for troops on patrol duties.

A group of villagers attempt to lynch a Nigerien national on the suspicion of involvement in an alleged ritual murder of a young girl. Four rioters were killed (some sources claim eight) when the police launched a defence, 89 arrested.
Various groups protest a ban on Okada-motorcycle business in the area.

Students of Lagos State University (LASU) External System stormed the Governors Office, Alausa, Ikeja, in protest over various complaints, including high fees, extended academic calendar, delayed issuance of results, among others.

No fewer than twenty persons have been feared dead and scores of others injured when Fulani herdsmen allegedly invaded Tunari village in Wukari Local Government of Taraba State. Fulani gunmen attack Mbar in Bokkos LGA killing five with machetes. The attack occurred during midday.

Anglican Church leaders and petitioners protest the destruction of their church building.

Young people believed to be students of the Federal Polytechnic, Ado-Ekiti, went on rampage as they protested power outage in Erifun community where many students of the institution are known to reside. notes: Boko Haram launches a "massive" attack on Konduga, 35km from Maiduguri, causing a three-hour battle with military forces. Reports indicate Boko Haram suffered heavy causalities before fleeing. Military forces captured several pieces of heavy equipment and weapons from the attackers. Xinhua places the death number of Boko Haram at 100, others place it as high as 120. Later reports suggest the causality total with as high as 250, with four injured military. A air force jet was downed during the operation - the pilot was later captured by Boko Haram, who nearly a month later released a video of his beheading.
Workers of the Federal Polytechnic, Ado Ekiti, have staged a protest and called for the removal of the Rector of the institution after several employees salaries had been cut.

During the early hours of the day unidentified gunmen burn a brewery and shoot sporadically. Witnesses place the death total between 50-55, others 18, though official reports hold the total at seven. Wukari is mainly Jukun, and it is believe the origin of the attack is related to the removal of the traditional ruler of the area.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill the Chief Magistrate for Enugu South at his home, specific location unknown.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram members reportedly took over Bama town - the second largest town in the state - and hoisted the sects flag, following a gun battle between they and Nigerian soldiers. "Scores" killed before soldiers fled the city alongside civilians - thousands displaced. Military sources who spoke to journalists in Maiduguri said the soldiers were able to kill about 70 of the militants and injure about 30 others. Some reports have the death total as high as 130. The number of soldiers and civilians killed are not known. Despite several sources reporting the fall a Bama to Boko Haram, Xinhua and This Day (Lagos) reports the military repelled the attack, the latter describing the battle as Boko Harams "Waterloo." It is possible Boko Haram retreated, regrouped, and attacked again. A military airstrike was involved in the battle.
BringBackOurGirls supporters marked the 140 days of the abduction of Chibok schoolgirls in a protest condemning government inaction.

Two persons were killed while many others were displaced in Shangev-Ya district of Kwande Local Government Area of Benue State, following a communal clash "at the weekend" between Dzev and Mbakyaa communities.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram attack and overtake Gamboru and Ngala towns, along the border with Cameroon. The attack began on a base in Gamboru, causing the 480 members of the military to flee into Cameroon, fifteen deaths reported. The also caused all military forces in nearby Ngala to flee as well, allowing Boko Haram to enter that town without resistance. In a response to the attacks, the Nigerian Air Force jet later dropped a massive bomb in the middle of Gamboru after hovering for several minutes in the air. The jet then left while the militants began a house-to-house raid in Gamboru. The attack occurred early in the morning. The attackers later attempted to destroy a bridge linking Nigeria with Cameroon.

Two villages in Wukari LGA are attacked by suspected Fulani gunmen. The attack caused villagers to flee and the destruction for their crops, causalities not known. The twin attacks comes only a day after two other villages in the area were attacked.

The attack occurred during the evening hours when Eggon youths attacked the Fulani village. The attack is believed to be motivated revenge for past Fulani attacks.
Property destruction: Unidentified attackers burn down a church in Sabon Garin Hyanbula - a location in Jigawa State. No causalities or injuries reported.

Gunmen attack Nwuban (Wumban), Muba (Jikun) and Nbishi villages of Wukari LGA. 13 reported killed 50 houses destroyed. Some sources claim 20 dead plus 85 injured. The identities of the attackers are believed to be Fulani.
Youths in Emohua community of Rivers State have protest against the setting up of an Ebola quarantine centre in their area by the state government for fear of outbreak.
A group of traders protest the destruction of their structures by the government.

Okada riders, believed to be mostly Chadian, clash with police during a protest. The reason for the protest is not known. Much of the property in the area was reported destroyed.
Unidentified gunmen, likely Fulani, attack Bishu village of Wukari killing six.

Youths in Patani Local Council took to the streets protesting the alleged imposition of a council chairmanship candidate who opposed President Johanthan, who they support.

It is believed Boko Haram targeted the facility after reported attempts from security forces to dislodge Boko Harams control from Gwoza, which had fallen under BH control several weeks earlier. Numerous trainees ("scores") were killed or seriously injured by the attackers, no numbers provided. It was later determined by Vanguard that 35 officers were declared missing following the attack. Following the takeover a video was released by the group declaring a caliphate in the area.
Hundreds of traders in Abuja staged a peaceful protest against imposition of multiple taxes on them by Abuja Municipal Area Council (AMAC).

Inhabitants of Igbei community in Auchi, Etsako West Local Government Area of Edo State on Thursday (21/08) took to the streets to protest alleged state government take over of their land, despite a court order.
Residents protest the poor state of local roads in Abule Ado.

Members of the Lagos State chapter, Nigeria Medical Association (NMA) at the Teaching Hospital, Idi-Araba staged a protest over the sacking of 16,000 resident doctors in the country by the federal government.

Members of an Anglican Church protest the destruction of their sanctuary by "thugs", which occurred late last week. The protest occurred in various locations in Onitsha, though the church building itself is in nearby Oyi LGA.

Meat sellers protest low patronage due to the outbreak of Ebola disease. The women under the aegis of Bushmeat Sellers Association lamented that since the announcement that the deadly disease could be caused by eating bush meat, spell had been cast on their sales. The protest took place at the governors office.
A group of 100+ youth protest the killing of a man by the anti-robbery police division.

Suspected insurgents (not named) ambushed and burnt down a police patrol vehicle at Tumu village in Akko Local Government Area of Gombe State. Injuries reported, no causalities.

Two persons have been reportedly killed in the early hours of the day by unknown attackers at Rafin Bwaunan Noma community in Bassa Local government Area of Plateau State. The victims included a 41 year old man and a young girl.

The clash is attributed to the contest for power between the two politicians ahead of the 2015 general elections. No injuries reported. The clash took place "at the weekend."

Students of Osun State University riot violently after it is learned that several of their fellow students may be punished following a recent accident.
Unknown gunmen have invaded Bara on motorcycles killing two persons, destroying Local Government Secretariat, Local Government Lodge, EPI Office, Court and Local Government Staff Quarters.

Protesting students clash with police, leaving four people hospitalized. The protest which was staged by the students of the Olabisi Onabanjo University, Ago-Iwoye, was for further reduction of school fees after government had reduced the fees. The students had earlier in the week stormed the entrance of the Governor's Office, Oke-Mosan, protesting the reduction of school fees in all the state-owned institutions. The situation turned chaotic on 15/08 when the students attempted to block the Ibara Government Reservation road, in order to ground vehicular movement.

assoc_actor_1: PHCN: Power Holding Company of Nigeria
notes: PHCN members protest at Sapele power station over unpaid back wages.

A group men protested against the killing of two persons by a policeman attached to the Iba Police Post at Iyana School Bus Stop. The protesters, who chanted war songs and held dangerous weapons, remained on the streets for more than three hours, threatening to set the police station on fire. The police maintain they were attacked by criminals, causing the killing.

Protest for and against the announcement for fees reduction by the Ogun State government turned bloody as students of the Olabisi Onabanjo University (OOU), Ago-Iwoye and those of Moshood Abiola Polytechnic (MAPOLY), engaged in a free for all fight. About four students were injured in the clash, which caused a traffic gridlock along the Abeokuta-Sagamu road. The students from the polytechnic had staged a rally in support of the fee reduction by the government while the university students staged a protest against the move.

Youths in Southern Kaduna (Unguwan Wakili) have protest against the endorsement of President Goodluck Jonathan for the 2015 Presidency by Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) and top government functionaries from their area. It is not clear if the youths identified with the PDP themselves. There was a police presence at the protest site, which restricted the group from entering a PDP convention hall.

Business and commercial activities were disrupted in parts of Port Harcourt, the Rivers State capital following clashes between supporters of the All Progressives Congress (APC) and the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), ahead of the planned visit of Governor Chibuike Rotimi Amaechi to Rumueprikom community in Obio/Akpor local government area of the state. The clashes were said to have started at the popular Wimpey Junction along Ikwerre Road in Port Harcourt, and later spread to Rumueme, also in Obio/Akpor local government area, and Diobu, in Port Harcourt City local government area. Several injuries reported.

Members of the APC blame the PDP for an attack against the home of the Minister of State for Education, which left seven people injured. The attack is believed to be in relation to several other disturbances between the PDP and APC around the Port Harcourt metro on 13/08.

Over 500 indigenes of Okpe Kingdom in Delta State protested to the state House of Assembly over alleged embezzlement of public fund by the Secretary, Delta State Board of Internal Revenue (DSBIR). The protesters held various place cards describing the Secretarys alleged corruptions.

Former workers of the Nigeria Telecommunications Ltd (NITEL) and Mobile Telecommunications Ltd (MTEL) shut the companys premises in Abuja, preventing staff and visitors entry or exit in protest against governments failure to pay them entitlements.
The BringBackOurGirls held a peaceful demonstration on the streets of Abuja.
Protesters of the NLC protest at the headquarters of a bank over its debt.

A group of woman and youths protest the alleged exclusion to them by Shell Oil to not hire members of their community for employment with the company. The military made a presence in the area, but there is no reported violence between they and the protesters.
Two factions of the PDP clash at a party meeting. One reported death, along with numerous minor injuries.

PDP supporters attack a group of APC celebrants following an election. The source reports a "clash," but does not detail any APC retaliation. Injuries not known. PDP members later attacked and damaged properties belonging to the father of the Executive Secretary of Ife South Local Government in the Gbodo area.
Students again protest the death of a fellow student at the hands of a suspected thief. The group had originally protested on 07/08.

Wives of soldiers protest their upcoming deployment to fight Boko Haram in Gwaza. The women burnt tyres along the streets, accusing army commanders of exploiting the war on terror for pecuniary gains. The group also blocked the main gate of the 21 Armoured Brigade. This is the second such protest in several days.
Unknown gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked Babayo-Zarazong village in Jos East Local Government Area, killing two persons and burning down several houses.
Suspected Fulani attack Yelwa, kill 14 and make off with 200 head of cattle. Earlier reports suggest five deaths and 400+ cattle stolen.
Property destruction: Members of the PDP destroyed the local government party secretariat of the APC in Akuku Toru. No reported to violence to APC members.

A 70-year-old woman led a group of protesters over the last months murder of her son. The group called for re-opening of a police investigation.

About eight persons were shot dead by unknown gunmen while two others were injured in Port Harcourt metropolis, Rivers State. The incident occurred less than eight hours after a cleric was killed during a clash between the people of Deeyor and Deken communities in Gokana Local Government Area of the state. The reason for the clash between the two communities not known.

Members of the Nigerian Human Rights Community (NHRC) took to the streets of Lagos State in large numbers to protest the Nasarawa State House of Assemblys plot to impeach Governor Umaru Tanko Al-Makura. Along with the NHRC, several other groups protested. The demonstrators protested along several streets throughout the state (specifics not known). Included in the protest was a sentiment of displeasure of the state of the nation.

About eight persons were shot dead by unknown gunmen while two others were injured in Port Harcourt metropolis, Rivers State. The incident occurred less than eight hours after a cleric was killed during a clash between the people of Deeyor and Deken communities in Gokana Local Government Area of the state. The reason for the clash between the two communities not known.

Gunmen in the early hours of the day abducted the younger brother to the Speaker of Bayelsa House of Assembly. The abduction comes at a time when as House Speaker in enduring possible impeachment proceedings.

Youths of Biseni clan in Yenagoa Local Government Area of Bayelsa State have shut down five oil wells in Idu Oil Field operated by the Nigerian Agip Oil Company. The protesting youths from, Egbebiri I and II and Akudonu, carried out the action on Sunday following the alleged refusal by Agip to provide a generating set for them one year after the oil company promised to do so. The youths were said to have erected blockades on the roads leading to wells 3, 6,8,11 and 12 chanting solidarity songs.

At least one person was killed and several others injured when unknown gunmen opened fire on worshippers during Sunday service at a Catholic Church in Ungwar Pau-Pau in Kachia Local Government Area of Kaduna State. The incident happened in the early hours of Sunday when the gunmen invaded Catholic Church during service, shooting sporadically.

At least one soldier and two police officers are dead following a clash between the two. Witnesses said the incident was due to an argument between a Divisional Police Officer (DPO) and a soldier, who was alleged to have overtaken the cop with his motorcycle. Further details vague. The exact date of the clash not known.

A traditional medical practitioner was *last weekend* - exact date not known - shot dead in Nkpor by some vigilante operatives for allegedly possessing some substances suspected to be charms and fresh animal parts.

Parents of secondary students enrolled in a public school in Osogbo protest at the office of the headmaster for improved boarding facilities. The group gave a five-day ultimatum before embarking on a mass protest.

Fourteen, including a teenage girl were reportedly killed in a communal clash between the Jukuns and Hausas in Jalingo of Ibi Local Government Area of Taraba State. Also, no fewer than 40 houses, vehicles and other properties worth millions of naira were destroyed in the bloody clash which erupted at about 4.30a.m. but was later brought under control by a combined team of soldiers and police that were drafted to the area to maintain peace. The clash may have stemmed from a robbery that had been seen a ethnically based earlier in the week.

Members of the APC protest against a proposed impeachment of the Nazarawa State Government.

TVG protests against the plan to impeach the Nasarawa State Governor by the State Legislature.

Four persons from Aguleri, Anambra East local government area were killed on Monday, while seven others were seriously injured in a renewed clash between the people of Aguleri and Echeno/Odeke in Ibaji local government area of Kogi State. The two groups were fighting over rights to oil production in the area. It is not clear if the Echeno/Odeke fighters were organized around ethnicity, or simply residents of the area.
Physically challenged persons in Nasarawa State staged a protest against the impeachment move by the state House of Assembly against the over alleged misconduct and mismanagement of state funds.
A clash between Fulani herdsmen and indigenes of Owukpa, Ogbadibo Local Government Area of Benue State has led to the death of one person while several others were injured.
Two groups of the Egbema clan clash over oil production rights. Six feared killed, including a leader of one side.

Unidentified attackers launched an assault on Fadan Karshi (Fadan Kaibi) during the early morning hours killing five peasants.

Property destruction: The private mansion of former FCT Minister, Lt General Jeremiah Useni in Langtang North Local Government Area of Plateau State, was on Thursday attacked by unknown gunmen, who shot sporadically into the air.

Police and Army members clash in Awka after a soldier is stopped by police and allegedly harassed while driving a motorcycle - the police were demanding a toll from those driving motorcycles. After complaint from the soldier the two groups clashed, but were dispersed before any injuries were sustained. Meanwhile, a group of motorcycle riders gathered in the are to protest the fee imposed by the police.

Members of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) Project Reloaded, Federal Capital Territory (FCT) chapter, on Thursday, staged a peaceful protest against the Boko Haram insurgency in the country, condemning the circumstances where innocent lives were being wasted by the insurgents.
Hundreds of secondary school teachers engaged in a peaceful protest against the state governments policy which they claimed had stagnated their career. The group sought an audience with the governor.
Motorcycle riders protest toll fee imposed on them by police.

Ethnic clashes hinging on politics erupted in Lafia, the Nasarawa State capital, over the impeachment notice filed again Governor Tanko Al-Makura by the House of Assembly. Youths of Eggon and Gwandara ethnic tribes engaged in a fight on the streets. Many were injured, three reported dead, 22 arrested. Reports indicate the incident began as a protest-counter protest that eventually led to the violence. Similar protests occurred the previous day in the city.

Protests in Keffi, Akwanga and Mararaba against Nasarawa lawmakers moves to impeach Governor Umaru Tanko Al-Makura.
Residents of Lekki protest against the proposed plan by the state government to acquire the their land, from which they would have to vacate. The exact date of the protest is not known.

Police, military and other security personnel confront protesters of impeachment proceedings undertaken by lawmakers at the Nasarawa State House of Assembly (NSHA) against Governor Umaru Tanko Al-Makura. Protests in Keffi, Akwanga and Mararaba against Nasarawa lawmakers moves to impeach Governor Umaru Tanko Al-Makura. In Keffi security forces dispersed the protesters.

No fewer than four persons were feared dead following a deadly clash between operatives of the Nigerian Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC), Neighbourhood Watch or CPYV and traders in FESTAC Town, Amuwo-Odofin Local Government Area (LGA) of Lagos State. The clash, which occurred in front of the LGA secretariat at 41 Road, FESTAC at about 4pm, started when some traders whose stores were demolished at Alakija, mobilised to protest the seizure of their goods. The previous day members of CPYV had gone on a rampage, targeting civilians.
PDP and APC politicians clash violently at the Zamfara State House after a legislation disagreement. Injuries not known.

Unknown assailants suspected to be Fulani herdsmen have attacked and killed five persons in Rakung area in the outskirts of Barkin Ladi town. The gunmen reportedly stormed the village at midnight when the residents were fast asleep, and killed their victims.

Following an attack by CPYV militia, the group reformed and numbering about a 100 reportedly stormed the premises of the local government with dangerous weapons such as guns, bottles and knives and attacked people there. The attack occurred at 5pm. Causalities and injuries of the second attack not clear.

Seven persons were killed Monday in an attack by unknown gunmen on Gidandawa village in Maradun LGA of Zamfara State. Police spokesman said that the gunmen stormed the village early Monday and started shooting at the people, leaving the seven dead. He said two other persons sustained serious injuries. Vanguard reports 50 dead in the attack.

Daily Trust claims 38 deaths as result of the attack, others 26, tough these numbers could be included in a military air raid used to repel the attackers following the attack.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Boko Haram gunmen attack Mandafuma village of Biu LGA, injuring one person while property worth millions of Naira destroyed.

The source claims the militia attacked "attacked everyone in sight." Several persons, among whom were officials of the local council as well as visitors sustained injuries in the process of the attack. The attack occurred at 3pm.

Police forces shoot and kill two AD protesters. Residents and supporters of AD launched a demonstration against the killings, causing the police to break up the protest with live ammunition - two deaths reported.

The bridge is located between Biu and Maiduguri (Damboa is located roughly half-way between the two towns.) Causalities if any not reported - it is not clear if theyre was traffic on the bridge at the time.

Students of Adeniran Ogunsanya College of Education (ACOED), Ijanikin, blocked the Mile 2-Badagry expressway to protest the death of three primary school pupils, who were crushed to death by a commercial bus driver. The students who were armed with clubs, cutlasses and bottles also set three commercial buses ablaze while several vehicles windscreens were shattered. The protest caused a gridlock along the Iyana Isashi-Agbara axis on the Mile 2- Badagry road. Though no life was lost as a result of the protest, several people were injured.

Hundreds of youths from the oil producing Ilaje Local Government Area of Ondo State protest the failure of a proposed merger between two oil companies. The protest was staged outside the governors office in Akure.
Scores of pensioners barricaded the major entry point to the National Assembly complex in protest against the non-provision for the payment of 53.4 percent increment in the 2014 Appropriation Act.
Obafemi Awolowo University is closed indefinitely after violent protests over school fees.

Pensioners under the aeigis of Association of Retired Heads of Service and Permanent Secretaries from Oyo and Osun states, protested non-payment of their pensions and other entitlements by the Federal Government. The protest occurred in Ibadan.

Other report that "scores" of Boko Haram agents were killed in the battle.

Abia State Commissioner for Agriculture, Dr. Kenneth Nwosu, shot by gunmen in Olokoro in Umuahia South Local Government Area of the state. The government official survived the attack. It was not clear whether the attack was an assassination attempt or a case of armed robbery.

Women in Obunagha community in Yenagoa LGA of Bayelsa State who shut down the Shell Petroleum Development Company (SPDC) Gbarain-Ubie gas plant during a protest. The group said the action was to draw attention to the perennial power outage in the community.
Unidentified gunmen abduct a State lawmaker. The victim is a member of All Progressives Congress (APC) and representing Etche Constituency in the state assembly.

notes: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram sect members attacked two border villages of Kwatara and Takaskala in Gwoza Local Council of Borno State, killing three passengers in two vehicles and injuring four others. Gwoza is a border town with Cameroun.

The attack accured between midnight and 2am in an undescribed location. Casualties/injuries not known.

Unknown gunmen numbering over 50 overran the Police station in Igumale town in Benue State and carted away arms from the armory of the station after overpowering the officers on duty. Casualties not known.
Students of Ogun State origin from the Federal University of Agriculture Abeokuta (FUNAAB) staged a protest in Abeokuta over non-payment of their 2013/2014 bursary.
Mubi traders protest the palnned distruction of their kiosks.

Students of Rufus Giwa Polytechnic, Owo, Ondo State, began a major protest against the hike in tuition fees at the institution. The protest occurred during the morning hours. The students have taken over the busy Owo/Abuja expressway and locked up the offices of the rector, Prof. Igbekele Ajibefun. They have also taken over the schools main gate, driving and marching around Owo to draw the attention of residents to their plight.

One person feared dead as members of Peoples Democratic Party attacked members of the All Progressive Congress at Ile-Ife. The incident occurred at Gbodo area, behind the palace of Ooni of Ife. The attack was initiated by a APC-backed militia known as the State Boys durning a PDP rally. In a PDP statement: "[Additionally] more than six vehicles belonging to innocent PDP members have been destroyed, countless numbers of shops razed and looted and several members of our party beaten and attacked with machetes".
A vigilante militia unsuccessfully attempted to lynch a suspected kidnapper.

BringBackOurGirls protesters attempt to baricade the Presidential Villa in the Aso Rock area, but are blocked by security forces.
Unidentified gunmen in the night-time opened fire on a group of Muslim worshippers in Bukuru, Jos South Local Government Area of Plateau State, injuring three persons. The attack occurred at 9pm.

notes: No fewer than six people were injured when suspected members of the National Union of Road Transport Workers (NURTW) attacked former chairman of the union in Ibadan, Oyo State. No fewer than 45 people were killed, 95 injured and 200 houses burnt down in Gashaka, Bashiri, Panwen, Barimini, Sabongida Zaga and Suntai in Bali local government area of Taraba State when gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen invaded a Tiv settlement. A witness claimed that the armed men numbering over 120 invaded the villages at about 1:42am after a heavy downpour and engaged in shooting and burning of houses.

No fewer than 50 [Boko Haram], five soldiers and one senior officer died on Friday night when some militants attacked the troops bases and police locations in Damboa. The attack was repelled by the military forces. Some reports claim the attack occurred in the early hours of Saturday. One report claims 59 deaths.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: No fewer than 15 passengers including motorists were killed when some gunmen suspected to be members of Boko Haram laid ambush along Maiduguri -Mafa- Dikwa Road yesterday at about 2:30pm.

The Speaker of the Edo State House of Assembly and 14 other All Progressives Congress (APC) lawmakers escaped death after over one hundred armed mobile policemen deployed from Abuja to the state, took over the premises of the state House of Assembly. The policemen who stormed the Assembly complex at about 11am started assaulting the staff of the Assembly in their offices, ordering them out of the premises. The police came to carry out a court order which barred four members of the assembly from entering the government house.

notes: Two suicide bombers suspected to be member of the Boko Haram sect in a golf saloon Volkswagen car laden with Improvised Explosive Device, IEDs rammed into a security checkpoints in Konduga Local Government Area of Borno state killing 5 members of vigilante youth popularly known as civilian JTF. The two suicide bombers are among the counted dead.
Okada riders protest the killing of a colleague by a hit-and-run driver.

Southern Kaduna youths took to the streets to protest the killing of about 200 people in Sanga Local Government Area of Kaduna State. Dressed in black attires, the youths matched for about 15 kilometres to present their letter to the Chief of Kagoro, for onward distribution to traditional rulers in the area, in hopes the rulers would organize a vigilante group.

Administrative and business activities came to a halt at ExxonMobil airstrip, Eket, Akwa Ibom State, as irate youths protesting against the recent oil spill blocked access to the facility. This was a continuation of a protest which began Monday.
Commercial motorcyclists at Ajibode area of Ibadan blocked the only motorable road to the area in protest of the death of two persons, including an okada rider. A similar protest took place in Apete.

Soldiers went on rampage, grounding human and vehicular movements along Ikorodu road, Lagos, following allegations that a commercial bus belonging to the Lagos State government ran over one of them, killing him at the Palmgrove bus stop at about 9:00 am. The soldiers alleged that a Rapid Transport Bus, BRT, vehicle killed one of their colleagues at Palmgrove. They reportedly burnt any BRT vehicle on sight during the rampage. The soldiers barricaded both sides of the road in the process. Some persons were also injured following the ensuing rampage.

Protesters disrupt a public hearing on electoral accountability organised by the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC). The protesters demanded free and fair elections and condemned what they saw as falsified election results.

Aides of delegates, particularly their drivers, protested at the entrance of Andrew Otutu Obaseki hall, over what they termed ill- treatment. According to the aides, they were deprived of allowances, welfare ranging from food to accommodation adding that while the delegates whom they drive sleep in better accommodations. The group was stopped at the entrance of the Hall by police.
Traders protest the planned demolition of their structures by the FCTA.

BringBackOurGirls campaigners protest at Unity Fountain for the release of the kidnapped, as well as against the perceived inactivity to recover them from the government. In response, Jonathan administration officials placed billboards outlining the achievements of the President near the fountain.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram sect, attacked and razed the police station in Shani, the headquarters of Shani Local Government Area of Borno State and made away with a patrol vehicle of the station, as well as other armaments. The resident said the gunmen did not attack any place apart from the police station, adding that people fled into the bush for fear of attack. No loss of life reported.

actor1: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: An explosive rocks a Maiduguri market at 8:20am. 56 dead, 68 injured. Authorities blame Boko Haram.
Reports of an explosion in Ife. No report of casualties.
A bomb planted by unknown persons exploded in the Asikolaiye area of Kaduna metropolis at about 9.30 pm. Two injuries reported.

A man believed was butchered at Bantaji in Wukari local government area of Taraba State. It was learned that a minor disagreement between a Tiv man and a Fulani man resulted in a fight that left the Tiv man in pieces in Wukari market. The incident degenerated into a factional clash as the squabble moved from the market to the major highway. Causalities and injuries from the larger second clash are not known.

assoc_actor_1: BESAN: Basic Education Staff Association of Nigeria
notes: Teachers under the Basic Education Staff Association of Nigeria, (BESAN) in Kogi State, embarked on a peaceful protest in Lokoja over non payment of salaries and leave allowances.

Residents of a community in Erinmope-Ekiti protest the proposed establishment of a new LGA by the governor, believe the change of political power in their community would be lopsided against them. The protesters threatened political succession from the LGA.

Business activities at the popular Ogbeogonogo market, Asaba, Delta State, were temporarily paralysed as the main gate of the market was put under lock and key for several hours in protest of the seizure of several generating sets by men of the state Fire Service Unit attached to the market.

Youths in Eket and Esit Eket in Akwa Ibom staged peaceful protests against fresh oil spills in Nkpana community from a Mobil facility in Ibeno. The youths numbering more than 500 protested on major streets in Eket, including the Marina and Terminal roads. The protesters believe the oil spill caused harm to the local aquatic life.
Law students at the University of Keffi demonstrated against the slashing of their bursary from N500,000 to N100,000.
A violent leadership struggle within the Tarok community leaves three dead, 20 injured and 500 houses destroyed. Those who initiated the violence were from Kadarko town.

In what they described as an unjustifiable imposition of fees on them by the management of the National Open University of Nigeria (NOUN), students of the Benin study centre staged two days peaceful protest in Benin City, Edo State.

Witnesses said that the suspected militant arrived the area in a convoy of motorcycles and were in possesion of dangerous weapons including guns and matches.
Two unidentified militants groups clash in a territorial battle in Bayelsa State. Three deaths reported.

actor2: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
notes: Suspected Islamic extremists sprayed gunfire at worshippers and torched four churches in a village just miles from Chibok. A protest against poor roads is led by a 90-year-old woman in Okoroba.

Women in Erhoike, host to Oil Mining Lease 30, compromising a flow station and oil and gas well, in Ethiope East Local Government Area of Delta State picketed the Nigerian Petroleum Development Company, NPDC, facility to draw attention to alleged neglect of the community.

Students of the Obafemi Awolowo University (OAU), Ile-Ife, Osun State, protest a hike in their school fees. The protesting students have locked down major buildings in the institution, with principal officers of the university locked up in the senate building.

About 200 church leaders and other clergy protest the Enugu State government plan to demolish their church.

University of Abuja students protest against an academic strike, clash with police. Police eventually implemented tear gas to disperse the students. The clash caused the university to close indefinitely. The students attempted the Vice Chancellor of the University.

Three people were reportedly killed in violent clashes over several days (not 14/06) by youths involved in defection from a political party to another in Ilorin. The fighting on Friday started around Abayawo area and spread to Alore, Ode Adana, Omoda, Ode-Alawusa and Okelele areas of the town, during which a person reportedly died. A group of the youths which lost one of their members on Friday reportedly launched a reprisal attack on Sunday where another person simply identified as Ebba was said to have been killed at Ode Alawusa area. The Sunday attack carried over to the following day.
